{"step_by_step_thinking": "Epinephrine, glucagon, and insulin are all peptide hormones, which typically act on the surface of target cells via second messengers. They do not cross the plasma membrane. On the other hand, thyroxine is a thyroid hormone, which is lipid-soluble and can cross the plasma membrane to act within the cell's nucleus.", "answer_choice": "D. Thyroxine"}
